name: tech-lead-align-and-ship
description: Planning and alignment prompts for tech leads: turn requirements into scope, tradeoffs, technical direction, rollout steps, and team-ready communication.
author: promptg-team

templates.name: tech-lead-feature-brief
templates.description: Turn requirements into a brief with scope, non-goals, and acceptance criteria.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Turn the requirements into a brief with scope, non-goals, and acceptance criteria.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Scope, Non-Goals, Acceptance Criteria, Risks, Questions, Next Steps
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 5 bullets; Scope <= 8 bullets; Non-Goals <= 8 bullets; Acceptance Criteria <= 10 bullets; Risks <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 8 bullets; Next Steps <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a tech lead turning requirements into a ship-ready brief.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Tech stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Requirements / context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Make scope boundaries crisp and testable. Write acceptance criteria as concrete, verifiable statements. Prefer a plan that supports iteration and de-risks early.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., 2-week deadline, no new services). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: tech-lead-tech-design-outline
templates.description: Draft a technical design with options, tradeoffs, and open questions.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Draft a technical design outline with options, tradeoffs, and open questions.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Options, Recommended Approach, Trade-offs, Open Questions, Next Steps
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 5 bullets; Options <= 3 options; Recommended Approach <= 8 bullets; Trade-offs <= 10 bullets; Open Questions <= 8 bullets; Next Steps <= 6 bullets

Role:
You are a tech lead drafting a decision-oriented technical design.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Tech stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Design context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Provide 2-3 realistic options, compare them on key criteria, and recommend one. Make assumptions explicit and surface open questions that block execution.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., cost cap, latency target, compliance). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: tech-lead-scope-tradeoffs
templates.description: Propose scope tradeoffs and phased delivery to hit constraints.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Propose scope tradeoffs and phased delivery to hit constraints.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Constraints, Options, Phased Plan, Recommendation, Risks, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Constraints <= 8 bullets; Options <= 6 bullets; Phased Plan <= 8 bullets; Recommendation <= 5 bullets; Risks <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 8 bullets

Role:
You are a tech lead protecting delivery by making trade-offs explicit.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Tech stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Extract the hard constraints (time, scope, cost, risk). Propose concrete trade-offs and a phased plan that delivers value early while preserving a path to the full solution.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., deadline, minimal team, avoid migrations). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: tech-lead-rollout-plan
templates.description: Plan rollout and migration with observability, gating, and rollback.
templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Plan rollout and migration with observability, gating, and rollback.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Rollout Steps, Observability, Gating, Rollback, Risks, Questions
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Rollout Steps <= 10 bullets; Observability <= 8 bullets; Gating <= 8 bullets; Rollback <= 8 bullets; Risks <= 8 bullets; Questions <= 8 bullets

Role:
You are a tech lead planning a safe rollout.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Tech stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Change context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Plan a rollout that reduces blast radius: include observability, gating criteria, and a practical rollback. Make unknowns explicit and turn them into questions or tasks.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., no downtime, phased rollout, feature flag required). It cannot add output sections.

templates.name: tech-lead-adr

templates.author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Write an ADR capturing context, decision, and consequences.

templates.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):

- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Title, Context, Decision, Alternatives, Consequences, Next Steps
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Title <= 1 line; each other section <= 10 bullets

You are a tech lead writing a concise ADR.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Tech stack (optional): {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- ADR context (required): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Capture the decision in a durable, scannable format. Make alternatives explicit and list consequences (both positive and negative).

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., keep it very short, exclude background). It cannot add output sections.
